title: The Endurance
occurrences: Shackleton's ship, Endurance, was named for his family motto:
Blackborow had fallen in love with the Endurance...
On December 5, 1 9 1 4, the Endurance left the island and headed south.
After six weeks of travel, the Endurance was only 1 00 miles from the continent...
In July, a blizzard raked the Endurance.
The Endurance survived, but as winter turned to spring, assaults continued.
All hands manned the pumps for three days and nights to save the Endurance.
Now nothing remained of the Endurance and her long battle...
Earlier, he had proposed to build a sloop from the wreckage of the Endurance.
The crew of the Endurance returned to a British nation...
...the Endurance expedition had been his last chance at glory.
...joined by a handful of the old Endurance crew:
Shackleton's feeling about the Endurance expedition...
